info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued July 02 at 11:11PM CDT until July 03 at 3:00AM CDT by NWS Bismarck
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 1145 PM CDT FOR SOUTHEASTERN MCLEAN...CENTRAL BURLEIGH...NORTHEASTERN MORTON AND SOUTHEASTERN OLIVER COUNTIES... At 1111 PM CDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from 8 miles southeast of Wilton to near Bismarck to 6 miles west of St. Anthony, moving east at 35 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and nickel size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect damage to roofs, siding, and trees. These severe storms will be near... Bismarck around 1115 PM CDT. Lincoln and Mcdowell Dam Recreation Area around 1125 PM CDT. Menoken around 1135 PM CDT. Other locations impacted by these severe thunderstorms include Double Ditch Indian Village, Sweet Briar Lake, Price, Mckenzie, Baldwin, Crown Butte Lake, Fort Abraham Lincoln State Park, University Of Mary, Arena and Judson. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building.
